info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 3:42PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock Island, Mercer, Whiteside, central Jo Daviess, western Carroll, northern Warren, Henry, northwestern Bureau, Jackson, eastern Cedar, northeastern Muscatine, Scott, southeastern Dubuque, southeastern Jones and Clinton Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 342 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bennett to near Seaton. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Tipton and Bennett around 345 PM CDT. Aledo and Lowden around 350 PM CDT. Viola, Wheatland, Matherville, Calamus, Toronto and Shale City around 355 PM CDT. New Windsor, Lost Nation, Cable, Boden and New Windsor around 400 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Sherrard, Nashville, Maquoketa, Orion, Andover, Delmar, Hurstville, Lynn Center, Coal Valley, Warner, Fulton, Colona, Andrew, Cleveland and Osborn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 270 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 34. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
